intro: Kochia dichoptera, commonly known as the two-lobed kochia, is an annual flowering plant native to North America. It is characterized by its distinctive, triangular-shaped leaves and vibrant, showy bracts that resemble flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, disturbed soils and is often found in prairies and along roadsides. Kochia dichoptera is part of the Amaranthaceae family and is known for its adaptability to arid environments. Its seeds are dispersed by wind, contributing to its wide distribution across its native range.
